SENSES.SENSE: used for talking about how much money a person or organization has<font color=blue> ex: The position is that we only accept new club members once a year. </font>
the place that someone or something has in a list or competition<font color=blue> ex: Following behind in fourth position is Jeff Gordon. </font>
where something is in relation to other things<font color=blue> ex: Here is a chart showing the positions of the planets. </font>
someone's rank or status in an organization or in society<font color=blue> ex: Stone's position within the party was strengthened after her speech at last year's convention. </font>
an opinion about an important issue<font color=blue> ex: Do you expect the administration to take a position one way or another on this legislation? </font>
the way that someone's body is placed<font color=blue> ex: Raise the lever to the up position to get the water to flow. </font>
a job in a company<font color=blue> ex: There are 12 women in management positions within the company. </font>
